1.text: An elder shouldest thou not reprove, but beseech as a father; the younger as brethren;

2.text: The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, in all purity.

4.text: And if any widow have children or descendants, let them learn first to be pious to their own house, and to return recompenses to their progenitors: for this is good and acceptable before God.

5.text: And she truly a widow, and forsaken, has hoped in God, and remains in supplications and prayers night and day.

6.text: And she living luxuriously is dead, living.

7.text: And these things proclaim, that they might be irreprehensible.

8.text: And if any for his own, and chiefly for his own household provide not, he has denied the faith, and is worse than the unbelieving.

9.text: Let not a widow be chosen less than sixty years, having been wife of one man,

10.text: Testified of in good works; if she have brought up children, if she lodged strangers, if she washed the feet of the holy, if she relieved the pressed, if she followed every good work.

11.text: And the younger widows reject: for when they conduct themselves arrogantly against Christ, they wish to marry:

12.text: Having judgment, for they put away the first faith.

13.text: And at the same time also they learn to be idle, going round about the houses; and not only idle, but also indulging in idle talk, and occupied with unnecessary things, speaking things not becoming.

14.text: I wish therefore the younger to marry, to bear children, to rule the house, to give no occasion to him opposing for reproach.

15.text: For already have some turned aside after Satan.

16.text: If any man or woman faithful have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be loaded; that it may relieve the truly widows.

17.text: Let the elders having presided well be deemed worthy of double honour, chiefly they being wearied in word and doctrine.

18.text: For the writing says, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox grinding. And, The laborer worthy of his hire.

19.text: Against an elder receive not an accusation from without, except from two or three witnesses.

20.text: Them having sinned rebuke before all, that the rest also have fear.

21.text: I call to witness before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the chosen angels, that thou watch these things without preference, doing nothing by bending.

22.text: Put hands swiftly upon none, nor participate in others’ sins: keep thyself pure.

23.text: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach and thy frequent weaknesses.

24.text: Some men’s sins are manifest, going before to judgment; and also to some they follow in the train.

25.text: Likewise also the good works of some are manifest; and having these otherwise, it cannot be hid.
